page.title: 12FLANDERS MOSS NEAR GARTMORE
page.content: S.W. of Gartmore, near to Offerance Farm, lies{Flanders Moss,}the last remaining part of a huge{raised bog formed after the last Ice-Age. The moss-lands used to stretch along the Forth Valley to Stirling, but now much has been drained and reclaimed for farmland or forestry. The Caledonia Peat Company cut peat for fuel and for garden compost and the few remaining {bogs}are in danger of drying out, as surrounding land drains and trees take over. The{Nature Conservancy Council and the{Scottish Wildlife Trust}are trying to preserve the last bogs as a {Nature Reserve.}Wildlife}includes: curlew, redshank, meadow pippet, grouse, butterflies and red ants. Plants include: species of{spagnum {moss,}heathers, cotton-grass, sun-dews and a rare flower the{Labrador Tea, like a small white rhododendron.
